questions.question: What level of alert would be inserted in field E of an ASHTAM following a volcanic eruption in which a pyroclastic ash cloud extends above FL250?
In which section of the AIP would you find information on holding, approach and departing procedures?
An integrated aeronautical information package consists of:
options: a. AIP and amendment service, supplement to the AIP, NOTAM, Pre-flight Information Bulletins (PIBs), AICs, checklists and summaries.
b. AIP and amendment service, NOTAM, Pre-flight Information Bulletins (PIBs), and AICS, AIRAC, checklists and summaries.
c. AIP and amendment service, supplement to the AIP, NOTAM, AIRAC, AICS, checklists and summaries.
d. AIP & Supplements, AIRAC, NOTAM and pre-flight bulletins.

questions.question: In what section of the AIP are details of SIGMET found?
Where in the AIP is a list of Location Indicators to be found?
A check list for NOTAM is issued:
options: d. at intervals of not more than one month.

questions.question: AIP approach charts do not give information for Instrument Approach Procedures for:
options: c. obstacles protruding above the obstacle free zone.

questions.question: AIP supplements with extensive text and graphics cover a short period. What is a long period in this respect?
AIRAC is:
options: b. operationally significant changes to the AIP.
d. an Army Air Corps publication.

questions.question: What information is not on an aerodrome approach plate?
options: d. Operating minima if the aerodrome is being used as an alternative.

questions.question: Where in the AIP is information concerning re-fuelling facilities and services found?
Where in the AIP would you find information concerning prohibited, restricted or danger areas?
In what part of the AIP are the details of SIGMET found?
What is the coefficient of braking, if the braking action is reported as medium?
Regarding the AIS what is the time limit for a checklist of current NOTAM to be issued?
